name: Bouncy Castle
tagline: Simple youtube to mp3 converter based on Cherrypy and Youtube-dl
body:
#Bouncy Castle

Bouncy castle is a self-hosted converter to convert Youtube videos (or Soundcloud musics) to mp3.
It's like [youtube-mp3.org](http://www.youtube-mp3.org/) but on **your** machine (and also, it does not block some videos like [youtube-mp3](http://www.youtube-mp3.org/)).

It is a simple web front-end to the CLI `youyube-dl` python converter.

## Roll your own !
Bouncy Castle is super easy, try it at home !
It has only few dependencies : `python2.7+` and `youyube-dl` (witch uses `ffmpeg`)

### Install
	git clone git://github.com/C4ptainCrunch/bouncycastle.git
	virtualenv --distribute --no-site-packages ve 
	source ve/bin/activate
	pip install -r requirements.txt
	
Check `config.py` for an example configuration file and put the values you want to overwrite in `production.py`

### Run
You should run `web.py` for the web interface and `convert.py` to convert the videos. (I use supervisord to run both)

## License
Bouncy Castle is AGPLv3+ licensed and heavily uses [youtube-dl](http://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/) which is in the Public Domain.  Bouncy also uses [CherryPy](http://www.cherrypy.org/ a lot (BSD licence).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
